}} 'Background' (U.S. Edge of Divorce) is a 1953 British domestic drama film
dealing with the effects of divorce, directed by Daniel Birt and starring
Valerie Hobson, Philip Friend and Norman Wooland. It was based on a stage play
by Warren Chetham-Strode, who also wrote the screenplay for the film.

A contemporary review in the [[Glasgow Herald]] gave the film a muted response,
describing Hobson as "shrill" and Wooland as "too sympathetic", adding : " A
heroic effort is made to apportion the blame fairly...yet intrinsically, one has
to admit, the film has no great success." [http://news.google.com/newspaper-
s?id=gBA1AAAAIBAJ&sjid=rqULAAAAIBAJ&pg=5878,4650066&dq=background+valerie+hobso-
n&hl=en "Breaking Points in Marriage"] Glasgow Herald, 19-10-1953. Retrieved 23-10-
2010
